text: The law of truly large numbers (a statistical comment), says that with a large enough number of independent samples, any result with constant probability >0 is likely to be seen.Everitt B.S. 2002. Cambridge Dictionary of Statistics, 2nd ed. ISBN 978-0521810999 We may highlight unlikely events and notice them more. The law is often used to falsify different pseudo-scientific claims.Beitman, Bernard D. (15 Apr 2018) Intrigued by the Low Probability of Synchronicities? Coincidence theorists and statisticians dispute the meaning of rare events. at psychologytoday == References == Category:Statistics
title: Law of truly large numbers
